title: My Story
text:
It started at NextShark, where I helped transform a scrappy financial news site into a cultural powerhouse for Asian American voices. We were a small team with big ambition, and I led the charge in growing our audience organically—reaching over 20 million people a month and turning Instagram into a hub for 150,000+ monthly engagements. That experience taught me how to move fast, ride trends, and build loyal communities from the ground up.



At Pollen, I stepped into a hybrid creative-strategic role, designing social content while brokering high-impact partnerships—like a $250K deal with Bumble. It was fast-paced, experimental, and a crash course in what it means to blend culture with commerce.



That balance of creativity and structure came into sharper focus at Hyatt Hotels, where I managed marketing efforts for three hotels under two global brands. I built campaign calendars around major events like the Long Beach Grand Prix, maintained brand consistency across channels, and advised internal teams on best practices. I learned how to operate within brand systems—without losing the human voice behind the content.



Then came Monster Energy, where I took on the digital “eyes and ears” of the brand. I developed campaign strategies that bridged live events and online presence, engaging fans in real time while protecting brand reputation. It was here that I really honed my skills in community management—knowing when to amplify, when to listen, and how to keep things authentic at scale.



Now at Niagara Bottling, I’ve brought that full toolkit to a brand ready to grow. In under a year, I’ve led social strategy that more than doubled our audience and increased engagement by 1500%, all while cutting ad spend in half. I manage our external agency with a tight grip on brand consistency and a wide lens for creative opportunities. We’re not just selling water—we’re building a brand people actually want to follow.

title: Projects
text:
Featured Quarto Projects
Netflix Pricing Strategy Built an interactive Quarto presentation analyzing consumer price sensitivity in the streaming industry. Applied Van Westendorp and Gabor-Granger techniques to assess willingness to pay and strategic bundling across major platforms.
Skills Demonstrated:

Pricing Analytics: Applied Van Westendorp and Gabor-Granger models to estimate willingness to pay.
Competitive Analysis: Benchmarked Netflix pricing against bundled competitors like Disney+ and Hulu.
Interactive Visualization: Designed an intuitive Quarto interface for dynamic presentation.
Strategic Recommendations: Proposed actionable pricing and bundling strategies.


Titanic Survival Analysis Used Quarto and the {gtsummary} package to explore survival trends on the Titanic. Presented logistic regression and cross-tab analysis to highlight how passenger demographics influenced outcomes.
Skills Demonstrated:

Logistic Regression: Modeled survival likelihood based on age, class, and gender.
Data Wrangling: Cleaned and transformed historical passenger data.
Statistical Communication: Used {gtsummary} to clearly convey model results.
Insight Generation: Interpreted findings to highlight sociocultural implications.


Brand Strategy Term Proposal Outlined a strategic marketing plan for a South Korean foodservice brand entering the U.S. Created a Quarto proposal detailing campaign strategy, digital media planning, and Gen Z engagement tactics.
Skills Demonstrated:

Campaign Planning: Built a full-funnel marketing strategy targeting Gen Z audiences.
Digital Media Strategy: Recommended influencer, paid social, and content activations.
Cross-Cultural Branding: Adapted messaging for U.S. market without losing brand identity.
Presentation Design: Structured a professional Quarto pitch deck with clear storytelling.


Summary Tables with gtsummaryl Created a Quarto presentation reflecting on the use of {gtsummary} for summarizing and visualizing statistical models. Demonstrated its role in improving data communication within marketing research.
Skills Demonstrated:

Go-to-Market Strategy: Developed a clear launch roadmap aligned with buyer needs.
Integrated Marketing: Orchestrated email, paid ads, social, and on-site promotions.
Budget Management: Allocated resources efficiently across tactics.
Launch Optimization: Tracked performance and refined tactics in real time.

title: Campaign Insights Dashboard
text:
Overview
This dashboard was built to monitor and analyze marketing campaign performance in real time. It tracks essential metrics like click-through rate, conversion rate, and ROI across digital channels.
Using R and Tableau, I transformed raw campaign data into interactive visuals that help marketers pinpoint underperforming segments, optimize spend, and communicate results clearly.




Learning Outcomes

Visualized KPIs like CTR, CVR, and CPA

Compared performance across A/B tests and platforms

Delivered insights to inform creative, media, and targeting





Key Skills Gained

Dashboard development in Tableau

R for data wrangling and summary tables

Campaign performance analysis

Executive storytelling with visuals

title: Marketing Funnel Attribution Model
text:
Overview
This project built an attribution model to assign value to touchpoints across a multi-channel conversion funnel. By comparing first-touch, last-touch, and linear models, I quantified each channel’s role in driving conversions.
These insights were used to reallocate budget toward high-impact channels, resulting in improved ROI and funnel efficiency.




Learning Outcomes

Tracked touchpoints across the funnel (impression → conversion)

Compared attribution models for fair credit assignment

Visualized assisted conversions and drop-offs

Identified underperforming mid-funnel channels





Key Skills Gained

Funnel mapping and attribution modeling

R: dplyr, ggplot2, shiny

Conversion rate optimization

Budget reallocation analysis

title: SEO
text:
Overview
In this project, I conducted a competitive SEO audit comparing keyword visibility, technical performance, and backlink authority across top industry players.
Using tools like Ahrefs and Screaming Frog, I identified keyword gaps and recommended a content strategy that increased visibility in SERPs and improved on-page performance metrics.




Learning Outcomes

Identified target keyword opportunities based on domain rank gaps

Benchmarked backlink counts and authority vs competitors

Proposed data-driven improvements to meta structure and internal linking





Key Skills Gained

Web scraping & SERP analysis

SEO toolsets (e.g., Ahrefs, SEMrush)

Competitive benchmarking

Data-informed content strategy
